data.title: Marisa Ryan Biography (1974-)
data.text:
Theatre, Film, and Television Biographies

John Romano to Waldo Salt

Marisa Ryan Biography (1974-)

Born November 20, 1974, in New York, NY; father, a teacher; mother, a singerand guidance counselor; married Jeremy Sisto (an actor), c. 1992. Addresses: Agent: Mitchell K. Stubbs & Associates, 8675 West Washington Blvd., Suite 203, Culver City, CA 90232.; Manager: McGowan Management, 8733 West Sunset Blvd., Suite 103, West Hollywood, CA 90069.

Nationality

American

Gender

Female

Occupation

Actress, director, writer

Birth Details

November 20, 1974

New York, New York, United States

Famous Works

CREDITS

Film Appearances

Justine Norris, Without a Trace, 1983

Arlene Gum, A Delicatessen Story, 1996

Julia Bradshaw, Love Always (also known as All Points Between), Legacy Releasing Corp., 1997

Suzy, Slaves to the Underground, First Look Pictures Releasing, 1997

Liz, Taylor's Return, Deer Valley, 1997

Zoe, With or without You, 1998

Gertrude, cigarette girl, Man of the Century, Fine Line Features,1999

Alex Staley, Trash (also known as No Fear and Nobody's Children), 1999

Viktoria, Cold Hearts, Raven Releasing, 1999

Dayna, The Cure for Boredom (also known as Sex & Bullets), Creative Light Entertainment, 2000

Janet (age 19), Riding in Cars with Boys, Sony Pictures Entertainment, 2001

Abby, Wet Hot American Summer, USA Films, 2001

Julia, Justice, 2003

Film Director

Three Women of Pain, 1997

Also directed Sessions.

Series

Detective Nell Delaney, New York Undercover (also known as Uptown Undercover), Fox, 1998

Hellen, "Unhappy Landings," The Pretender, NBC, 1997

"Closet Justice," The Practice, ABC, 1999

Nina G., "Twenty-Something Girls vs. Thirty-Something Women," Sex andthe City, HBO, 1999

Melanie, Third Watch, NBC, 1999

Dede Napoli, "Windows," Falcone, 2000

Dede Napoli, "That's Amore," Falcone, 2000

Dede Napoli, "You Can't Always Get What You Want," Falcone, 2000

Guest, The Test, F/X, 2001

Stage Appearances

Appeared in The Other Side, Repertory Theatre, London; AnotherPart of the Forest and Little Foxes, both Cleveland Playhouse, Cleveland, OH; Something So Right, Playwrights Horizons; and Picnic, Cherry Lane Theatre.

WRITINGS
